title: Wind Cave National Park: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial         On July 8 and 9, 2016, a Wind Cave Reunion will be held in the park. Come re-discover the park and connect with friends old and new.   2016 Wind Cave Reunion In honor of the Centennial of the National Park Service, Wind Cave National Park is planning to host a reunion of friends and former employees July 8 and 9, 2016.    To register for reunion activities, please fill out this form and send a check made out to Wind Cave Employee Association, Wind Cave National Park, 26611 U.S. Highway 385, Hot Springs, SD 57747. To contact the park, you can e-mail us, or call 605-745-4600.  To see a list of who has registered at this point (June 26, 2016) click here.  Good news about the Saturday night dinner! We have been able to reduce the price to $23.00 for adults and added a children's price. If you have already registered you will get a refund! Friday July 8   VIP Center (or Rec. Hall, as some of you may know it) will be available beginning at 2 p.m. A Bar-B-Que at the VIP Center at starting 6:00 pm Informal Cave Tours that evening starting at 7:00, 7:20, 7:40, and 8:00 spaces are limited - be sure to sign-up. NPS Campfire Program at the Elk Mountain Campground at 9:00 pm Saturday, July 9  VIP Center available from 8 a.m. until 2 pm to gather and talk. Scheduled hikes to the recently acquired Sanson Ranch and nearby buffalo jump - spaces are limited - be sure to sign up. A program about Kati Stabler at 1:00 in the visitor center auditorium. Program about Persistence Cave at 2:30 in the visitor center auditorium. Regularly scheduled cave tours at normal prices at the visitor center. Social hour at the Mueller Civic Center in Hot Springs 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm. A catered dinner and program at the Mueller Center in Hot Springs at 6:00 pm. After dinner program - about 7:30 pm. Check back for updates. If you are in contact with any former WICA folks, please share this information with them, as our current address list may not be up to date.  NPS Centennial    The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Wind Cave National Park is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences    Check back for experiences in this park. To find other national park experiences, visit the experiences search.
